New Records: De’Aaron Fox scored 109 points over a two-game span, the most in team history.
Key Match Events: Fox recorded a triple-double with 35 points, 15 rebounds, and 12 assists.
Sacramento sealed the win on Fox’s two free throws with 1.8 seconds remaining.
The Jazz led by as many as 11 in the third quarter before the Kings battled back and tied the game at 107 on Huerter’s 3-pointer with 5:25 remaining in the contest.
Pre-Game Insights: The Kings played without Domantas Sabonis (lower back tightness), DeMar DeRozan (low back tightness), and Malik Monk (right ankle sprain).
Post-Match Reflections: Fox made three 3-pointers and scored 18 points on 7-of-7 shooting overall in the first quarter to give the Kings a 35-31 lead.
Lauri Markkanen led Utah with 25 points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fox was 16-for-30 from the field, 3-for-4 from 3-point range and 14-for-19 from the free-throw line.
Trailing 116-113 with 1:54 remaining, Sacramento scored five straight points on Fox’s jump shot and Jordan McLaughlin’s 3-pointer.
